001    package com.winupon.andframe.bigapple.bitmap.cache;
002    
003    import java.io.BufferedWriter;
004    import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
005    import java.io.Closeable;
006    import java.io.EOFException;
007    import java.io.File;
008    import java.io.FileInputStream;
009    import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
010    import java.io.FileOutputStream;
011    import java.io.FilterOutputStream;
012    import java.io.IOException;
013    import java.io.InputStream;
014    import java.io.InputStreamReader;
015    import java.io.OutputStream;
016    import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
017    import java.io.Reader;
018    import java.io.StringWriter;
019    import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
020    import java.io.Writer;
021    import java.nio.charset.Charset;
022    import java.security.MessageDigest;
023    import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
024    import java.util.ArrayList;
025    import java.util.Iterator;
026    import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
027    import java.util.Map;
028    import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
029    import java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue;
030    import java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor;
031    import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
032    import java.util.regex.Matcher;
033    import java.util.regex.Pattern;
034    
035    import org.apache.http.protocol.HTTP;
036    
037    import com.winupon.andframe.bigapple.io.IOUtils;
038    import com.winupon.andframe.bigapple.utils.log.LogUtils;
039    
040    /**
041     * Âü∫‰∫éLruÁÆóÊ≥ïÁöÑAndroidÁ£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠ò„Ä?br>
042     * 
043     * A cache that uses a bounded amount of space on a filesystem. Each cache entry has a string key and a fixed number of
044     * values. Values are byte sequences, accessible as streams or files. Each value must be between {@code 0} and
045     * {@code Integer.MAX_VALUE} bytes in length.
046     * <p/>
047     * <p>
048     * The cache stores its data in a directory on the filesystem. This directory must be exclusive to the cache; the cache
049     * may delete or overwrite files from its directory. It is an error for multiple processes to use the same cache
050     * directory at the same time.
051     * <p/>
052     * <p>
053     * This cache limits the number of bytes that it will store on the filesystem. When the number of stored bytes exceeds
054     * the limit, the cache will remove entries in the background until the limit is satisfied. The limit is not strict: the
055     * cache may temporarily exceed it while waiting for files to be deleted. The limit does not include filesystem overhead
056     * or the cache journal so space-sensitive applications should set a conservative limit.
057     * <p/>
058     * <p>
059     * Clients call {@link #edit} to create or update the values of an entry. An entry may have only one editor at one time;
060     * if a value is not available to be edited then {@link #edit} will return null.
061     * <ul>
062     * <li>When an entry is being <strong>created</strong> it is necessary to supply a full set of values; the empty value
063     * should be used as a placeholder if necessary.
064     * <li>When an entry is being <strong>edited</strong>, it is not necessary to supply data for every value; values
065     * default to their previous value.
066     * </ul>
067     * Every {@link #edit} call must be matched by a call to {@link Editor#commit} or {@link Editor#abort}. Committing is
068     * atomic: a read observes the full set of values as they were before or after the commit, but never a mix of values.
069     * <p/>
070     * <p>
071     * Clients call {@link #get} to read a snapshot of an entry. The read will observe the value at the time that
072     * {@link #get} was called. Updates and removals after the call do not impact ongoing reads.
073     * <p/>
074     * <p>
075     * This class is tolerant of some I/O errors. If files are missing from the filesystem, the corresponding entries will
076     * be dropped from the cache. If an error occurs while writing a cache value, the edit will fail silently. Callers
077     * should handle other problems by catching {@code IOException} and responding appropriately.
078     */
079    public final class LruDiskCache implements Closeable {
080        static final String JOURNAL_FILE = "journal";
081        static final String JOURNAL_FILE_TEMP = "journal.tmp";
082        static final String JOURNAL_FILE_BACKUP = "journal.bkp";
083    
084        static final String MAGIC = "libcore.io.DiskLruCache";
085        static final String VERSION_1 = "1";
086        static final long ANY_SEQUENCE_NUMBER = -1;
087        static final Pattern LEGAL_KEY_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("[a-z0-9_-]{1,64}");
088    
089        private static final String CLEAN = "CLEAN";
090        private static final String DIRTY = "DIRTY";
091        private static final String REMOVE = "REMOVE";
092        private static final String READ = "READ";
093    
094        /**
095         * Á£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠òÁöÑÊó•ÂøóÊ†ºÂºèÂ¶Ç‰∏? <br>
096         * libcore.io.DiskLruCache <br>
097         * 1 -----------Á£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠òÁöÑÁâàÊú¨‰ø°ÊÅ?br>
098         * 100 ---------Â∫îÁî®ÁöÑÁâàÊú¨‰ø°ÊÅ?br>
099         * 2------------ÁºìÂ≠òÁöÑÊï∞Èá?br>
100         * -------------Á©∫Ë°å <br>
101         * DIRTY 1a7bd9492ce711c1c9400fd885296988 <br>
102         * CLEAN 1a7bd9492ce711c1c9400fd885296988 t_1382060889349 55361 <br>
103         * REMOVE 335c4c6028171cfddfbaae1a9c313c52 <br>
104         * READ 335c4c6028171cfddfbaae1a9c313c52 <br>
105         * READ 3400330d1dfc7f3f7f4b8d4d803dfcf6
106         * 
107         * 
108         * Each of the subsequent lines in the file is a record of the state of a cache entry. Each line contains
109         * space-separated values: a state, a key, and optional state-specific values. o DIRTY lines track that an entry is
110         * actively being created or updated. Every successful DIRTY action should be followed by a CLEAN or REMOVE action.
111         * DIRTY lines without a matching CLEAN or REMOVE indicate that temporary files may need to be deleted. o CLEAN
112         * lines track a cache entry that has been successfully published and may be read. A publish line is followed by the
113         * lengths of each of its values. o READ lines track accesses for LRU. o REMOVE lines track entries that have been
114         * deleted.
115         * 
116         * The journal file is appended to as cache operations occur. The journal may occasionally be compacted by dropping
117         * redundant lines. A temporary file named "journal.tmp" will be used during compaction; that file should be deleted
118         * if it exists when the cache is opened.
119         */
120    
121        private final File directory;// ÁºìÂ≠òÁõÆÂΩï
122        private final File journalFile;
123        private final File journalFileTmp;
124        private final File journalFileBackup;
125    
126        private final int appVersion;
127        private long maxSize;
128        private final int valueCount;
129        private long size = 0;
130    
131        private Writer journalWriter;
132        private final LinkedHashMap<String, Entry> lruEntries = new LinkedHashMap<String, Entry>(0, 0.75f, true);
133        private int redundantOpCount;
134    
135        private long nextSequenceNumber = 0;
136    
137        final ThreadPoolExecutor executorService = new ThreadPoolExecutor(0, 1, 60L, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
138                new LinkedBlockingQueue<Runnable>());
139        private final Callable<Void> cleanupCallable = new Callable<Void>() {
140            @Override
141            public Void call() throws Exception {
142                synchronized (LruDiskCache.this) {
143                    if (journalWriter == null) {
144                        return null; // Closed.
145                    }
146                    trimToSize();
147                    if (journalRebuildRequired()) {
148                        rebuildJournal();
149                        redundantOpCount = 0;
150                    }
151                }
152                return null;
153            }
154        };
155    
156        private LruDiskCache(File directory, int appVersion, int valueCount, long maxSize) {
157            this.directory = directory;
158            this.appVersion = appVersion;
159            this.journalFile = new File(directory, JOURNAL_FILE);
160            this.journalFileTmp = new File(directory, JOURNAL_FILE_TEMP);
161            this.journalFileBackup = new File(directory, JOURNAL_FILE_BACKUP);
162            this.valueCount = valueCount;
163            this.maxSize = maxSize;
164        }
165    
166        /**
167         * ÂàùÂßãÂåñÊâìÂº?£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠?
168         * 
169         * @param directory
170         *            ÁºìÂ≠òË∑ØÂæÑ
171         * @param appVersion
172         *            Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÁâàÊú¨
173         * @param valueCount
174         *            ÁºìÂ≠òÊï∞Èáè
175         * @param maxSize
176         *            ÁºìÂ≠òÊú?§ßÂÆπÈáè
177         * @return
178         * @throws IOException
179         */
180        public static LruDiskCache open(File directory, int appVersion, int valueCount, long maxSize) throws IOException {
181            if (maxSize <= 0) {
182                throw new IllegalArgumentException("ÈùûÊ≥ïÂèÇÊï∞ÈîôËØØÔºåÂéüÂõ†Ôºö ÁºìÂ≠òÊú?§ßÂÆπÈáèmaxSize <= 0");
183            }
184    
185            if (valueCount <= 0) {
186                throw new IllegalArgumentException("ÈùûÊ≥ïÂèÇÊï∞ÈîôËØØÔºåÂéüÂõ†ÔºöÁºìÂ≠òÊï∞valueCount <= 0");
187            }
188    
189            // Â¶ÇÊûúÂ§á‰ªΩÊñá‰ª∂Â≠òÂú®ÔºåËØ¥Êòé‰∏ä‰∏?¨°Âú®ËÆ∞ÂΩïÊó•ÂøóÁöÑÊó∂Â?ÂºÇÂ∏∏ÈÄ?á∫‰∫ÜÔºåÊâ?ª•ÊÅ¢Â§çÂ§á‰ªΩÊñá‰ª∂
190            File backupFile = new File(directory, JOURNAL_FILE_BACKUP);
191            if (backupFile.exists()) {
192                File journalFile = new File(directory, JOURNAL_FILE);
193                if (journalFile.exists()) {
194                    backupFile.delete();// Âà†Èô§ÂºÇÂ∏∏ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÊó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª?
195                }
196                else {
197                    renameTo(backupFile, journalFile, false);// ÊÅ¢Â§çÂ§á‰ªΩÊñá‰ª∂
198                }
199            }
200    
201            // Prefer to pick up where we left off.
202            LruDiskCache cache = new LruDiskCache(directory, appVersion, valueCount, maxSize);
203            if (cache.journalFile.exists()) {
204                try {
205                    cache.readJournal();
206                    cache.processJournal();
207                    cache.journalWriter = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(new FileOutputStream(cache.journalFile,
208                            true), HTTP.US_ASCII));
209                    return cache;
210                }
211                catch (IOException journalIsCorrupt) {
212                    LogUtils.e(
213                            "DiskLruCache " + directory + " is corrupt: " + journalIsCorrupt.getMessage() + ", removing",
214                            journalIsCorrupt);
215                    cache.delete();
216                }
217            }
218    
219            // Á¨¨‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÔºåÊñ∞Âª∫ÁõÆÂΩïÂíåÊó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª?
220            directory.mkdirs();
221            cache = new LruDiskCache(directory, appVersion, valueCount, maxSize);
222            cache.rebuildJournal();
223            return cache;
224        }
225    
226        // ËØªÂèñÊó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª∂
227        private void readJournal() throws IOException {
228            StrictLineReader reader = null;
229            try {
230                reader = new StrictLineReader(new FileInputStream(journalFile));
231                String magic = reader.readLine();
232                String version = reader.readLine();
233                String appVersionString = reader.readLine();
234                String valueCountString = reader.readLine();
235                String blank = reader.readLine();
236                if (!MAGIC.equals(magic) || !VERSION_1.equals(version)
237                        || !Integer.toString(appVersion).equals(appVersionString)
238                        || !Integer.toString(valueCount).equals(valueCountString) || !"".equals(blank)) {
239                    throw new IOException("Êó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª∂Â§¥Ê†ºÂºèÈîôËØ? [" + magic + ", " + version + ", " + valueCountString + ", " + blank
240                            + "]");
241                }
242    
243                int lineCount = 0;
244                while (true) {
245                    try {
246                        readJournalLine(reader.readLine());
247                        lineCount++;
248                    }
249                    catch (EOFException endOfJournal) {
250                        // Êó•Â≠êËØªÂèñÂà∞ÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄË°?
251                        break;
252                    }
253                }
254                redundantOpCount = lineCount - lruEntries.size();// ÂÜó‰ΩôÁöÑÊï∞Èá?
255            }
256            finally {
257                IOUtils.closeQuietly(reader);
258            }
259        }
260    
261        // ËØªÂèñÊó•ÂøóÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÊØè‰∏?°å
262        private void readJournalLine(String line) throws IOException {
263            int firstSpace = line.indexOf(' ');
264            if (firstSpace == -1) {
265                throw new IOException("unexpected journal line: " + line);
266            }
267    
268            int keyBegin = firstSpace + 1;
269            int secondSpace = line.indexOf(' ', keyBegin);
270            final String diskKey;
271            if (secondSpace == -1) {
272                diskKey = line.substring(keyBegin);
273                if (firstSpace == REMOVE.length() && line.startsWith(REMOVE)) {
274                    // REMOVEËÆ∞ÂΩïÂ§ÑÁêÜ
275                    lruEntries.remove(diskKey);
276                    return;
277                }
278            }
279            else {
280                diskKey = line.substring(keyBegin, secondSpace);
281            }
282    
283            Entry entry = lruEntries.get(diskKey);
284            if (entry == null) {
285                entry = new Entry(diskKey);
286                lruEntries.put(diskKey, entry);
287            }
288    
289            if (secondSpace != -1 && firstSpace == CLEAN.length() && line.startsWith(CLEAN)) {
290                // CLEANÊó•ÂøóÂ§ÑÁêÜ
291                entry.readable = true;
292                entry.currentEditor = null;
293                String[] parts = line.substring(secondSpace + 1).split(" ");
294                if (parts.length > 0) {
295                    try {
296                        if (parts[0].startsWith("t_")) {
297                            entry.expiryTimestamp = Long.valueOf(parts[0].substring(2));
298                            entry.setLengths(parts, 1);
299                        }
300                        else {
301                            entry.expiryTimestamp = Long.MAX_VALUE;
302                            entry.setLengths(parts, 0);
303                        }
304                    }
305                    catch (Exception e) {
306                        throw new IOException("unexpected journal line: " + line);
307                    }
308                }
309            }
310            else if (secondSpace == -1 && firstSpace == DIRTY.length() && line.startsWith(DIRTY)) {
311                // DIRTYÊó•ÂøóÂ§ÑÁêÜ
312                entry.currentEditor = new Editor(entry);
313            }
314            else if (secondSpace == -1 && firstSpace == READ.length() && line.startsWith(READ)) {
315                // READÊó•ÂøóÂ§ÑÁêÜ
316                // This work was already done by calling lruEntries.get().
317            }
318            else {
319                throw new IOException("unexpected journal line: " + line);
320            }
321        }
322    
323        // Â§ÑÁêÜÊó•Âøó
324        private void processJournal() throws IOException {
325            deleteIfExists(journalFileTmp);
326            for (Iterator<Entry> i = lruEntries.values().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
327                Entry entry = i.next();
328                if (entry.currentEditor == null) {
329                    for (int t = 0; t < valueCount; t++) {
330                        size += entry.lengths[t];
331                    }
332                }
333                else {
334                    entry.currentEditor = null;
335                    for (int t = 0; t < valueCount; t++) {
336                        deleteIfExists(entry.getCleanFile(t));
337                        deleteIfExists(entry.getDirtyFile(t));
338                    }
339                    i.remove();
340                }
341            }
342        }
343    
344        // ÈáçÊñ∞ËÆ∞ÂΩïÊó•ÂøóÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂ∑≤ÊúâÊó•ÂøóÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÂ∞Ü‰ºöË¢´ÊõøÊç?
345        private synchronized void rebuildJournal() throws IOException {
346            if (journalWriter != null) {
347                IOUtils.closeQuietly(journalWriter);
348            }
349    
350            Writer writer = null;
351            try {
352                writer = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(new FileOutputStream(journalFileTmp), HTTP.US_ASCII));
353                writer.write(MAGIC);
354                writer.write("\n");
355                writer.write(VERSION_1);
356                writer.write("\n");
357                writer.write(Integer.toString(appVersion));
358                writer.write("\n");
359                writer.write(Integer.toString(valueCount));
360                writer.write("\n");
361                writer.write("\n");
362    
363                for (Entry entry : lruEntries.values()) {
364                    if (entry.currentEditor != null) {
365                        writer.write(DIRTY + ' ' + entry.diskKey + '\n');
366                    }
367                    else {
368                        writer.write(CLEAN + ' ' + entry.diskKey + " t_" + entry.expiryTimestamp + entry.getLengths()
369                                + '\n');
370                    }
371                }
372            }
373            finally {
374                IOUtils.closeQuietly(writer);
375            }
376    
377            if (journalFile.exists()) {
378                renameTo(journalFile, journalFileBackup, true);
379            }
380            renameTo(journalFileTmp, journalFile, false);
381            journalFileBackup.delete();
382    
383            journalWriter = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(new FileOutputStream(journalFile, true),
384                    HTTP.US_ASCII));
385        }
386    
387        private static void deleteIfExists(File file) throws IOException {
388            if (file.exists() && !file.delete()) {
389                throw new IOException();
390            }
391        }
392    
393        private static void renameTo(File from, File to, boolean deleteDestination) throws IOException {
394            if (deleteDestination) {
395                deleteIfExists(to);
396            }
397            if (!from.renameTo(to)) {
398                throw new IOException();
399            }
400        }
401    
402        public synchronized long getExpiryTimestamp(String key) throws IOException {
403            String diskKey = DiskCacheKeyGenerator.generate(key);
404            checkNotClosed();
405            validateKey(diskKey);
406            Entry entry = lruEntries.get(diskKey);
407            if (entry == null) {
408                return 0;
409            }
410            else {
411                return entry.expiryTimestamp;
412            }
413        }
414    
415        public Snapshot get(String key) throws IOException {
416            String diskKey = DiskCacheKeyGenerator.generate(key);
417            return getByDiskKey(diskKey);
418        }
419    
420        private synchronized Snapshot getByDiskKey(String diskKey) throws IOException {
421            checkNotClosed();
422            validateKey(diskKey);
423            Entry entry = lruEntries.get(diskKey);
424            if (entry == null) {
425                return null;
426            }
427    
428            if (!entry.readable) {
429                return null;
430            }
431    
432            // If expired, delete the entry.
433            if (entry.expiryTimestamp < System.currentTimeMillis()) {
434                for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
435                    File file = entry.getCleanFile(i);
436                    if (file.exists() && !file.delete()) {
437                        throw new IOException("failed to delete " + file);
438                    }
439                    size -= entry.lengths[i];
440                    entry.lengths[i] = 0;
441                }
442                redundantOpCount++;
443                journalWriter.append(REMOVE + ' ' + diskKey + '\n');
444                lruEntries.remove(diskKey);
445                if (journalRebuildRequired()) {
446                    executorService.submit(cleanupCallable);
447                }
448                return null;
449            }
450    
451            // Open all streams eagerly to guarantee that we see a single published
452            // snapshot. If we opened streams lazily then the streams could come
453            // from different edits.
454            FileInputStream[] ins = new FileInputStream[valueCount];
455            try {
456                for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
457                    ins[i] = new FileInputStream(entry.getCleanFile(i));
458                }
459            }
460            catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
461                // A file must have been deleted manually!
462                for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
463                    if (ins[i] != null) {
464                        IOUtils.closeQuietly(ins[i]);
465                    }
466                    else {
467                        break;
468                    }
469                }
470                return null;
471            }
472    
473            redundantOpCount++;
474            journalWriter.append(READ + ' ' + diskKey + '\n');
475            if (journalRebuildRequired()) {
476                executorService.submit(cleanupCallable);
477            }
478    
479            return new Snapshot(diskKey, entry.sequenceNumber, ins, entry.lengths);
480        }
481    
482        public Editor edit(String key) throws IOException {
483            String diskKey = DiskCacheKeyGenerator.generate(key);
484            return editByDiskKey(diskKey, ANY_SEQUENCE_NUMBER);
485        }
486    
487        private synchronized Editor editByDiskKey(String diskKey, long expectedSequenceNumber) throws IOException {
488            checkNotClosed();
489            validateKey(diskKey);
490            Entry entry = lruEntries.get(diskKey);
491            if (expectedSequenceNumber != ANY_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
492                    && (entry == null || entry.sequenceNumber != expectedSequenceNumber)) {
493                return null; // Snapshot is stale.
494            }
495    
496            if (entry == null) {
497                entry = new Entry(diskKey);
498                lruEntries.put(diskKey, entry);
499            }
500            else if (entry.currentEditor != null) {
501                return null; // Another edit is in progress.
502            }
503    
504            Editor editor = new Editor(entry);
505            entry.currentEditor = editor;
506    
507            // Flush the journal before creating files to prevent file leaks.
508            journalWriter.write(DIRTY + ' ' + diskKey + '\n');
509            journalWriter.flush();
510            return editor;
511        }
512    
513        public File getDirectory() {
514            return directory;
515        }
516    
517        public synchronized long getMaxSize() {
518            return maxSize;
519        }
520    
521        public synchronized void setMaxSize(long maxSize) {
522            this.maxSize = maxSize;
523            executorService.submit(cleanupCallable);
524        }
525    
526        public synchronized long size() {
527            return size;
528        }
529    
530        private synchronized void completeEdit(Editor editor, boolean success) throws IOException {
531            Entry entry = editor.entry;
532            if (entry.currentEditor != editor) {
533                throw new IllegalStateException();
534            }
535    
536            // If this edit is creating the entry for the first time, every index
537            // must have a value.
538            if (success && !entry.readable) {
539                for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
540                    if (!editor.written[i]) {
541                        editor.abort();
542                        throw new IllegalStateException("Newly created entry didn't create value for index " + i);
543                    }
544                    if (!entry.getDirtyFile(i).exists()) {
545                        editor.abort();
546                        return;
547                    }
548                }
549            }
550    
551            for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
552                File dirty = entry.getDirtyFile(i);
553                if (success) {
554                    if (dirty.exists()) {
555                        File clean = entry.getCleanFile(i);
556                        dirty.renameTo(clean);
557                        long oldLength = entry.lengths[i];
558                        long newLength = clean.length();
559                        entry.lengths[i] = newLength;
560                        size = size - oldLength + newLength;
561                    }
562                }
563                else {
564                    deleteIfExists(dirty);
565                }
566            }
567    
568            redundantOpCount++;
569            entry.currentEditor = null;
570            if (entry.readable | success) {
571                entry.readable = true;
572                journalWriter
573                        .write(CLEAN + ' ' + entry.diskKey + " t_" + entry.expiryTimestamp + entry.getLengths() + '\n');
574                if (success) {
575                    entry.sequenceNumber = nextSequenceNumber++;
576                }
577            }
578            else {
579                lruEntries.remove(entry.diskKey);
580                journalWriter.write(REMOVE + ' ' + entry.diskKey + '\n');
581            }
582            journalWriter.flush();
583    
584            if (size > maxSize || journalRebuildRequired()) {
585                executorService.submit(cleanupCallable);
586            }
587        }
588    
589        private boolean journalRebuildRequired() {
590            final int redundantOpCompactThreshold = 2000;
591            return redundantOpCount >= redundantOpCompactThreshold //
592                    && redundantOpCount >= lruEntries.size();
593        }
594    
595        /**
596         * Âà†Èô§ÁºìÂ≠ò
597         * 
598         * @param key
599         * @return
600         * @throws IOException
601         */
602        public boolean remove(String key) throws IOException {
603            String diskKey = DiskCacheKeyGenerator.generate(key);
604            return removeByDiskKey(diskKey);
605        }
606    
607        private synchronized boolean removeByDiskKey(String diskKey) throws IOException {
608            checkNotClosed();
609            validateKey(diskKey);
610            Entry entry = lruEntries.get(diskKey);
611            if (entry == null || entry.currentEditor != null) {
612                return false;
613            }
614    
615            for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
616                File file = entry.getCleanFile(i);
617                if (file.exists() && !file.delete()) {
618                    throw new IOException("failed to delete " + file);
619                }
620                size -= entry.lengths[i];
621                entry.lengths[i] = 0;
622            }
623    
624            redundantOpCount++;
625            journalWriter.append(REMOVE + ' ' + diskKey + '\n');
626            lruEntries.remove(diskKey);
627    
628            if (journalRebuildRequired()) {
629                executorService.submit(cleanupCallable);
630            }
631    
632            return true;
633        }
634    
635        public synchronized boolean isClosed() {
636            return journalWriter == null;
637        }
638    
639        private void checkNotClosed() {
640            if (journalWriter == null) {
641                throw new IllegalStateException("cache is closed");
642            }
643        }
644    
645        public synchronized void flush() throws IOException {
646            checkNotClosed();
647            trimToSize();
648            journalWriter.flush();
649        }
650    
651        @Override
652        public synchronized void close() throws IOException {
653            if (journalWriter == null) {
654                return; // Already closed.
655            }
656            for (Entry entry : new ArrayList<Entry>(lruEntries.values())) {
657                if (entry.currentEditor != null) {
658                    entry.currentEditor.abort();
659                }
660            }
661            trimToSize();
662            journalWriter.close();
663            journalWriter = null;
664        }
665    
666        private void trimToSize() throws IOException {
667            while (size > maxSize) {
668                Map.Entry<String, Entry> toEvict = lruEntries.entrySet().iterator().next();
669                removeByDiskKey(toEvict.getKey());
670            }
671        }
672    
673        public void delete() throws IOException {
674            IOUtils.closeQuietly(this);
675            deleteContents(directory);
676        }
677    
678        private void validateKey(String diskKey) {
679            Matcher matcher = LEGAL_KEY_PATTERN.matcher(diskKey);
680            if (!matcher.matches()) {
681                throw new IllegalArgumentException("keyÂøÖÈ°ªÁ¨¶ÂêàÊ≠£ÂàôË°®ËææÂºèÔºö[a-z0-9_-]{1,64}: \"" + diskKey + "\"");
682            }
683        }
684    
685        private static String inputStreamToString(InputStream in) throws IOException {
686            return readFully(new InputStreamReader(in, HTTP.UTF_8));
687        }
688    
689        private static final OutputStream NULL_OUTPUT_STREAM = new OutputStream() {
690            @Override
691            public void write(int b) throws IOException {
692                // Eat all writes silently. Nom nom.
693            }
694        };
695    
696        // ///////////////////////////////////// Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÊñπÊ≥ï
697        // //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
698        private static String readFully(Reader reader) throws IOException {
699            StringWriter writer = null;
700            try {
701                writer = new StringWriter();
702                char[] buffer = new char[1024];
703                int count;
704                while ((count = reader.read(buffer)) != -1) {
705                    writer.write(buffer, 0, count);
706                }
707                return writer.toString();
708            }
709            finally {
710                IOUtils.closeQuietly(reader);
711                IOUtils.closeQuietly(writer);
712            }
713        }
714    
715        // ÈÄíÂΩíÂà†Èô§
716        private static void deleteContents(File dir) throws IOException {
717            File[] files = dir.listFiles();
718            if (files == null) {
719                throw new IOException("not a readable directory: " + dir);
720            }
721            for (File file : files) {
722                if (file.isDirectory()) {
723                    deleteContents(file);
724                }
725                if (file.exists() && !file.delete()) {
726                    throw new IOException("failed to delete file: " + file);
727                }
728            }
729        }
730    
731        // ////////////////////////////////////////////ÂÜÖÈÉ®Á±?////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
732    
733        // ////////////////////////////////////‰∏•Ê†ºÁöÑË°åÈòÖËØªÂô®StrictLineReader//////////////////////////////////////////////
734        /**
735         * ‰∏•Ê†ºÁöÑË°åÈòÖËØªÂô®StrictLineReader
736         * 
737         * @author xuan
738         * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2013-9-17 ‰∏ãÂçà7:21:29 $
739         */
740        private class StrictLineReader implements Closeable {
741            private static final byte CR = (byte) '\r';
742            private static final byte LF = (byte) '\n';
743    
744            private final InputStream in;
745            private final Charset charset = Charset.forName(HTTP.US_ASCII);
746    
747            /*
748             * Buffered data is stored in {@code buf}. As long as no exception occurs, 0 <= pos <= end and the data in the
749             * range [pos, end) is buffered for reading. At end of input, if there is an unterminated line, we set end ==
750             * -1, otherwise end == pos. If the underlying {@code InputStream} throws an {@code IOException}, end may remain
751             * as either pos or -1.
752             */
753            private byte[] buf;
754            private int pos;
755            private int end;
756    
757            public StrictLineReader(InputStream in) {
758                this(in, 8192);
759            }
760    
761            public StrictLineReader(InputStream in, int capacity) {
762                if (in == null) {
763                    throw new NullPointerException();
764                }
765                if (capacity < 0) {
766                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("capacity <= 0");
767                }
768    
769                this.in = in;
770                buf = new byte[capacity];
771            }
772    
773            @Override
774            public void close() throws IOException {
775                synchronized (in) {
776                    if (buf != null) {
777                        buf = null;
778                        in.close();
779                    }
780                }
781            }
782    
783            /**
784             * Reads the next line. A line ends with {@code "\n"} or {@code "\r\n"}, this end of line marker is not included
785             * in the result.
786             * 
787             * @return the next line from the input.
788             * @throws IOException
789             *             for underlying {@code InputStream} errors.
790             * @throws EOFException
791             *             for the end of source stream.
792             */
793            public String readLine() throws IOException {
794                synchronized (in) {
795                    if (buf == null) {
796                        throw new IOException("LineReader is closed");
797                    }
798    
799                    // Read more data if we are at the end of the buffered data.
800                    // Though it's an error to read after an exception, we will let
801                    // {@code fillBuf()}
802                    // throw again if that happens; thus we need to handle end == -1
803                    // as well as end == pos.
804                    if (pos >= end) {
805                        fillBuf();
806                    }
807                    // Try to find LF in the buffered data and return the line if
808                    // successful.
809                    for (int i = pos; i != end; ++i) {
810                        if (buf[i] == LF) {
811                            int lineEnd = (i != pos && buf[i - 1] == CR) ? i - 1 : i;
812                            String res = new String(buf, pos, lineEnd - pos, charset.name());
813                            pos = i + 1;
814                            return res;
815                        }
816                    }
817    
818                    // Let's anticipate up to 80 characters on top of those already
819                    // read.
820                    ByteArrayOutputStream out = new ByteArrayOutputStream(end - pos + 80) {
821                        @Override
822                        public String toString() {
823                            int length = (count > 0 && buf[count - 1] == CR) ? count - 1 : count;
824                            try {
825                                return new String(buf, 0, length, charset.name());
826                            }
827                            catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
828                                throw new AssertionError(e); // Since we control the
829                                                             // charset this will
830                                                             // never happen.
831                            }
832                        }
833                    };
834    
835                    while (true) {
836                        out.write(buf, pos, end - pos);
837                        // Mark unterminated line in case fillBuf throws
838                        // EOFException or IOException.
839                        end = -1;
840                        fillBuf();
841                        // Try to find LF in the buffered data and return the line
842                        // if successful.
843                        for (int i = pos; i != end; ++i) {
844                            if (buf[i] == LF) {
845                                if (i != pos) {
846                                    out.write(buf, pos, i - pos);
847                                }
848                                out.flush();
849                                pos = i + 1;
850                                return out.toString();
851                            }
852                        }
853                    }
854                }
855            }
856    
857            /**
858             * Reads new input data into the buffer. Call only with pos == end or end == -1, depending on the desired
859             * outcome if the function throws.
860             */
861            private void fillBuf() throws IOException {
862                int result = in.read(buf, 0, buf.length);
863                if (result == -1) {
864                    throw new EOFException();
865                }
866                pos = 0;
867                end = result;
868            }
869        }
870    
871        // //////////////////////////////////////////Á£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠òkeyÁîüÊàêÂô?////////////////////////////////////////////////////
872        /**
873         * Á£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠òkeyÁîüÊàêÂô?
874         * 
875         * @author xuan
876         * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2013-9-17 ‰∏ãÂçà7:19:33 $
877         */
878        private static class DiskCacheKeyGenerator {
879            private DiskCacheKeyGenerator() {
880            }
881    
882            public static String generate(String key) {
883                String cacheKey;
884                try {
885                    final MessageDigest mDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5");
886                    mDigest.update(key.getBytes());
887                    cacheKey = bytesToHexString(mDigest.digest());
888                }
889                catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
890                    // ÂΩìËØ∑Ê±ÇÁÆóÊ≥ïÂú®ÁâπÂÆöÁéØÂ¢É‰∏≠‰∏çÂèØÁî®Êó?
891                    cacheKey = String.valueOf(key.hashCode());
892                }
893                return cacheKey;
894            }
895    
896            // Â≠óËäÇËΩ?6ËøõÂà∂‰∏?
897            private static String bytesToHexString(byte[] bytes) {
898                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
899                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
900                    String hex = Integer.toHexString(0xFF & bytes[i]);
901                    if (hex.length() == 1) {
902                        sb.append('0');
903                    }
904                    sb.append(hex);
905                }
906                return sb.toString();
907            }
908        }
909    
910        /**
911         * ÂØπÂ∫î‰∏?∏™keyÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂Êù°ÁõÆÔºà‰∏?∏™keyÂèØÂåÖÂê´Â§ö‰∏™Êñá‰ª∂Ôºâ
912         * 
913         * @author xuan
914         * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2013-9-17 ‰∏ãÂçà7:57:30 $
915         */
916        private final class Entry {
917            private final String diskKey;
918    
919            private long expiryTimestamp = Long.MAX_VALUE;// ËøáÊúüÊó∂Èó¥
920    
921            private final long[] lengths;// Êù°ÁõÆÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÈïøÂ∫?
922            private boolean readable;// Êù°ÁõÆÊñá‰ª∂ÊòØÂê¶ÂèØËØª
923            private Editor currentEditor;// Êù°ÁõÆÁöÑÁºñËæëÂô®
924            private long sequenceNumber;// Êù°ÁõÆÊµÅÊ∞¥Âè?
925    
926            private Entry(String diskKey) {
927                this.diskKey = diskKey;
928                this.lengths = new long[valueCount];
929            }
930    
931            public String getLengths() throws IOException {
932                StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
933                for (long size : lengths) {
934                    result.append(' ').append(size);
935                }
936                return result.toString();
937            }
938    
939            /**
940             * ËÆæÁΩÆÈïøÂ∫¶ÔºåËØ∑Áî®ÂçÅËøõÂà∂Ôºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºö"10123"
941             * 
942             * @param strings
943             *            ÂçÅËøõÂà∂Êï∞Áª?
944             * @param startIndex
945             *            Âº?ßãËÆæÁΩÆÁöÑ‰ΩçÁΩÆÁ¥¢Âº?
946             * @throws IOException
947             */
948            private void setLengths(String[] strings, int startIndex) throws IOException {
949                if ((strings.length - startIndex) != valueCount) {
950                    throw invalidLengths(strings);
951                }
952    
953                try {
954                    for (int i = 0; i < valueCount; i++) {
955                        lengths[i] = Long.parseLong(strings[i + startIndex]);
956                    }
957                }
958                catch (NumberFormatException e) {
959                    throw invalidLengths(strings);
960                }
961            }
962    
963            private IOException invalidLengths(String[] strings) throws IOException {
964                throw new IOException("unexpected journal line: " + java.util.Arrays.toString(strings));
965            }
966    
967            public File getCleanFile(int i) {
968                return new File(directory, diskKey + "." + i);
969            }
970    
971            public File getDirtyFile(int i) {
972                return new File(directory, diskKey + "." + i + ".tmp");
973            }
974        }
975    
976        /**
977         * Êù°ÁõÆÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÁºñËæëÂô®ÔºåÁî®‰∫éÂØπÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑËØªÂÜ?
978         * 
979         * @author xuan
980         * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2013-9-17 ‰∏ãÂçà8:00:54 $
981         */
982        public final class Editor {
983            private final Entry entry;
984            private final boolean[] written;
985            private boolean hasErrors;
986            private boolean committed;
987    
988            private Editor(Entry entry) {
989                this.entry = entry;
990                this.written = (entry.readable) ? null : new boolean[valueCount];
991            }
992    
993            public void setEntryExpiryTimestamp(long timestamp) {
994                entry.expiryTimestamp = timestamp;
995            }
996    
997            public InputStream newInputStream(int index) throws IOException {
998                synchronized (LruDiskCache.this) {
999                    if (entry.currentEditor != this) {
1000                        throw new IllegalStateException();
1001                    }
1002                    if (!entry.readable) {
1003                        return null;
1004                    }
1005                    try {
1006                        return new FileInputStream(entry.getCleanFile(index));
1007                    }
1008                    catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
1009                        return null;
1010                    }
1011                }
1012            }
1013    
1014            public String getString(int index) throws IOException {
1015                InputStream in = newInputStream(index);
1016                return in != null ? inputStreamToString(in) : null;
1017            }
1018    
1019            public OutputStream newOutputStream(int index) throws IOException {
1020                synchronized (LruDiskCache.this) {
1021                    if (entry.currentEditor != this) {
1022                        throw new IllegalStateException();
1023                    }
1024                    if (!entry.readable) {
1025                        written[index] = true;
1026                    }
1027                    File dirtyFile = entry.getDirtyFile(index);
1028                    FileOutputStream outputStream;
1029                    try {
1030                        outputStream = new FileOutputStream(dirtyFile);
1031                    }
1032                    catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
1033                        // ÂàõÂª∫ÁºìÂ≠òÁõÆÂΩï
1034                        directory.mkdirs();
1035                        try {
1036                            outputStream = new FileOutputStream(dirtyFile);
1037                        }
1038                        catch (FileNotFoundException e2) {
1039                            // Êó†Ê≥ïÊÅ¢Â§çÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåËøîÂõû‰∏Ä‰∏™Á©∫ËæìÂá∫Êµ?
1040                            return NULL_OUTPUT_STREAM;
1041                        }
1042                    }
1043                    return new FaultHidingOutputStream(outputStream);
1044                }
1045            }
1046    
1047            public void set(int index, String value) throws IOException {
1048                Writer writer = null;
1049                try {
1050                    writer = new OutputStreamWriter(newOutputStream(index), HTTP.UTF_8);
1051                    writer.write(value);
1052                }
1053                finally {
1054                    IOUtils.closeQuietly(writer);
1055                }
1056            }
1057    
1058            public void commit() throws IOException {
1059                if (hasErrors) {
1060                    completeEdit(this, false);
1061                    removeByDiskKey(entry.diskKey); // The previous entry is stale.
1062                }
1063                else {
1064                    completeEdit(this, true);
1065                }
1066                committed = true;
1067            }
1068    
1069            public void abort() throws IOException {
1070                completeEdit(this, false);
1071            }
1072    
1073            public void abortUnlessCommitted() {
1074                if (!committed) {
1075                    try {
1076                        abort();
1077                    }
1078                    catch (IOException ignored) {
1079                    }
1080                }
1081            }
1082    
1083            /**
1084             * ‰∏?∏™ÈùôÈªòÁöÑËæìÂá∫ÊµÅÔºåÂºÇÂ∏∏Êó∂ËÉΩË¢´ÈªòÈªòÁöÑÊçïÊçâÂà∞
1085             * 
1086             * @author xuan
1087             * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2014-5-5 ‰∏äÂçà9:44:33 $
1088             */
1089            private class FaultHidingOutputStream extends FilterOutputStream {
1090                private FaultHidingOutputStream(OutputStream out) {
1091                    super(out);
1092                }
1093    
1094                @Override
1095                public void write(int oneByte) {
1096                    try {
1097                        out.write(oneByte);
1098                    }
1099                    catch (IOException e) {
1100                        hasErrors = true;
1101                    }
1102                }
1103    
1104                @Override
1105                public void write(byte[] buffer, int offset, int length) {
1106                    try {
1107                        out.write(buffer, offset, length);
1108                        out.flush();
1109                    }
1110                    catch (IOException e) {
1111                        hasErrors = true;
1112                    }
1113                }
1114    
1115                @Override
1116                public void close() {
1117                    try {
1118                        out.close();
1119                    }
1120                    catch (IOException e) {
1121                        hasErrors = true;
1122                    }
1123                }
1124    
1125                @Override
1126                public void flush() {
1127                    try {
1128                        out.flush();
1129                    }
1130                    catch (IOException e) {
1131                        hasErrors = true;
1132                    }
1133                }
1134            }
1135        }
1136    
1137        /**
1138         * Á£ÅÁõòÁºìÂ≠òÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êù°ÁõÆÊñá‰ª∂ÔºàÂåÖÂê´Â§ö‰∏™ÊµÅÔºâ
1139         * 
1140         * @author xuan
1141         * @version $Revision: 1.0 $, $Date: 2013-9-17 ‰∏ãÂçà8:07:27 $
1142         */
1143        public final class Snapshot implements Closeable {
1144            private final String diskKey;
1145            private final long sequenceNumber;
1146            private final FileInputStream[] ins;
1147            private final long[] lengths;
1148    
1149            private Snapshot(String diskKey, long sequenceNumber, FileInputStream[] ins, long[] lengths) {
1150                this.diskKey = diskKey;
1151                this.sequenceNumber = sequenceNumber;
1152                this.ins = ins;
1153                this.lengths = lengths;
1154            }
1155    
1156            /**
1157             * Returns an editor for this snapshot's entry, or null if either the entry has changed since this snapshot was
1158             * created or if another edit is in progress.
1159             */
1160            /**
1161             * ËøîÂõûÊù°ÁõÆÁöÑÁºñËæëÂØπË±?
1162             * 
1163             * @return
1164             * @throws IOException
1165             */
1166            public Editor edit() throws IOException {
1167                return LruDiskCache.this.editByDiskKey(diskKey, sequenceNumber);
1168            }
1169    
1170            /**
1171             * Ëé∑ÂèñÊåáÂÆöÊµÅÔºåÊú™Âä†ËøáÁºìÂ≠òÁöÑ
1172             * 
1173             * @param index
1174             * @return
1175             */
1176            public FileInputStream getInputStream(int index) {
1177                return ins[index];
1178            }
1179    
1180            public String getString(int index) throws IOException {
1181                return inputStreamToString(getInputStream(index));
1182            }
1183    
1184            public long getLength(int index) {
1185                return lengths[index];
1186            }
1187    
1188            @Override
1189            public void close() {
1190                for (InputStream in : ins) {
1191                    IOUtils.closeQuietly(in);
1192                }
1193            }
1194        }
1195    
1196    }
